column1: #Text=In the following Examples 5, 6 and 7, the various catalyst compositions are made in geometrical shape III in FIG. 1 as in Example 2.

#Text=The coprecipitate for making the active catalyst phase is obtained by dissolving 242.4 g Fe(NO.sub.3).sub.3.9H.sub.2 O, 232.8 g Co(NO.sub.3).sub.2.6H.sub.2 O, 1744.8 g Ni(NO.sub.3).sub.2.6H.sub.2 O and 5.1 g KNO.sub.3 in 3.1 liters of water; and while stirring, at 90.degree.
#Text=C., one first of all adds a solution of 34.9 g Sm.sub.2 O.sub.3 in 212 g of concentration HNO.sub.3.
#Text=To this solution one adds, while stirring, 300.5 g of highly dispersed silicic acid (Aerosil 200) and 300.5 g tempered montmorillonite (specific surfaces according to BET <1 m.sup.2 /g).
#Text=C., one prepares a solution of 2118.6 g (NH.sub.4).sub.6 Mo.sub.7 O.sub.24.6H.sub.2 O in 2.7 liters H.sub.2 O and to it, while stirring intensively, one adds 115.3 g of 85% H.sub.3 PO.sub.4.
#Text=Thereafter, both solutions are combined amid intensive stirring and a solution of 485.1 g Bi(NO.sub.3).sub.3.5H.sub.2 O in 408 g 8.2% HNO.sub.3 is added.
#Text=The suspension thus obtained is dried in a spray drier at a drying air entry temperature of 550.degree.
#Text=The ratio between drying air volume and sprayed suspension quantity is adjusted here so that one gets an exit temperature of 170.degree.
#Text=C. and the suspension quantity is adjusted so that one gets a time of 6 seconds spent by the sprayed dried powder in the spray drier.
#Text=The atomization intensity is selected so that one gets a sprayed particle with an average diameter dp=25 .mu.m.
#Text=The dried spray dried powder is calcined for 30 minutes in a rotary cylindrical kiln at a maximum temperature of the spray dried powder of 420.degree.
#Text=The further processing of the calcined spray dried powder takes place as in Example 2, except that the extruded hollowed strand has an inside diameter of 2 mm.
